br.com.limaogames.librpg.framework.abstracts

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.limaogames.librpg.framework.abstracts.Job
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JobListener, java.io.Serializable

    public abstract class Job
extends java.lang.Object
implements JobListener, java.io.Serializable
    Class to be inherited by Adventurer class. A enormous variety of jobs can be implemented inheriting this class. Adventurer jobs can store unique Skill list, such as Accessory, Armor, Helm, Weapon and Shield. It can be created a job tree with this class using another instance of this to be next after this instance level reaches the max value allowed. This class instance can store a list of Job as prerequisites to upgrade another Job.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Limao Games
    Email: andreikeda@limaogames.com.br
    created on: 07/02/2014
    See Also:
    Accessory, Armor, Helm, JobListener, Serializable, Skill, Shield, Weapon, Serialized Form

      • Job

        public Job(int MAX_LEVEL)
        Class constructor
        Parameters:
        MAX_LEVEL - - Integer that stores the max level this instance can reach. This value is usually "final" so it cannot be changed.

      • create

        public void create(long id,
          java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description,
          int level,
          java.util.List<Job> prerequisites,
          java.util.List<Weapon.Type> allowedWeapons,
          java.util.List<Armor.Type> allowedArmors,
          java.util.List<Accessory.Type> allowedAccessories,
          java.util.List<Helm.Type> allowedHelms,
          java.util.List<Shield.Type> allowedShields,
          java.util.List<Skill> skills,
          int[] attBonus,
          int[] apIncrement,
          Job nextJob)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Creates instance of Job.
        Specified by:
        create in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        id - - object's identifier.
        name - - object's name. It can be null, but it's not recommended.
        description - - object's description. It can be null.
        level - - object's level. It can't be bigger than MAX_LEVEL.
        prerequisites - - object's list of prerequisites to set this Job instance as Adventurer job.
        allowedWeapons - - object's list of Weapon instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedArmors - - object's list of Armor instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedAccessories - - object's list of Accessory instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedHelms - - object's list of Helm instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedShields - - object's list of Shield instances that are allowed to equip.
        skills - - object's list of Skill that Adventurer learns.
        attBonus - - object's array of int that stores the amount increment on Adventurer attributes.
        apIncrement - - object's array of int that stores the amount of AP to level up.
        nextJob - - object's Job instance that keeps an instance of the next Job when Adventurer upgrade it.

        public Job getNextJob()
        Return instance's upgrade Job. If this instance can't be upgraded, it returns null.
        Returns:
        Job instance or null.

      • getPrerequisites

        public java.util.List<Job> getPrerequisites()
        Return a list of Job that serves as prerequisites to instatiate this Job instance. It can be commonly used on upgrade process if the game allows. If not, returns an empty list.
        Returns:
        Job list.

      • getSkills

        public java.util.List<Skill> getSkills()
        Return a list of Skill the Adventurer learns while the Adventurer job is this instance.
        Returns:
        Skill list.

      • getAPIncrement

        public int[] getAPIncrement()
        Return an array of int that stores the AP increment. AP can be the normal xp the Adventurer gets once he wins a battle or make something useful on the game, but normally the AP is used in different way. Job instances can stores its own xp, so they upgrade in a different way than Adventurer attributes.
        Returns:
        Array of int - AP increment.

      • levelUp

        public boolean levelUp(int ap)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Returns if Adventurer instance can level up its job. You can use the common xp or a variation (here it's called ap) to keep track of the amount xp Adventurer has on a job.
        Specified by:
        levelUp in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        ap - - Integer amount of xp Adventurer has on a job.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if Adventurer can level up its job or false otherwise.

      • upgrade

        public boolean upgrade(Adventurer adventurer)
        Description copied from interface: JobListener
        Returns if Adventurer can upgrade its job. This method is available if your game allows Job upgrade. Ex: a soldier job can be upgrade to warrior/general/other that you wish.
        Specified by:
        upgrade in interface JobListener
        Parameters:
        adventurer - Adventurer - instance of Adventurer.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can upgrade its job or false otherwise.
